'''''SEVEN 18''''' is the eighteenth volume of the [[Marion E. Wade Center]]'s annual journal ''[[SEVEN]]'', published in [[2001]].<ref name="jstor" />
==Contents==
*"Dedication of the New Marion E. Wade Center Remarks"
**By: Director Chris Mitchell, Wheaton College Provost Stanton Jones, Honorable Robert Culshaw, Barbara Reynolds, and a poem by Jill Baumgaertner
*"''Quorum Porum'': The Literary Cats of T.S. Eliot, Ruth Pitter, and Dorothy L. Sayers"
**By: Don King
*"Continuing Research on 2nd Lieutenant Lewis"
**By: K.J. Gilchrist
*"Charles Williams and the Tradition of Alchemy"
**By: Gavin Ashenden
*"The Versatile C.S. Lewis: Latin Scholar"
**By: Arthur Rupprecht<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/article_index|articlename=Contents By Volume|website=[https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/index VII: Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center]|accessed=13 August 2025}}</ref>
